str2: And, even, also, namely.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably from the same base as massaomai and mnaomai; to disclose, i.e. Report, declare, intimate.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A thorn bush or bramble. Of uncertain derivation; a brier shrub.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
(Hebrew), Isaac, the patriarch. Of Hebrew origin; Isaac, the son of Abraham.
And, even, also, namely.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Of Hebrew origin; Jacob, the progenitor of the Israelites.
